developer_registration.reason_fillout: To avoid longer waiting time until your account is validated please fill out contact person and purpose of registration carefully such that an administrator may decide quickly about your access request.

developer_testusers.title: Test Users
developer_testusers.empty: There are no test users registered for this account.
developer_testusers.description: Using these buttons you can register additional users for testing your plugins. By test users, plugins are run locally (from 'localhost') and not on the server.

appmessages.title: Predefined Messages for App:
appmessages.empty: There are no app specfic messages defined yet.

reasons.REGISTRATION_BY_OTHER_PERSON: Registration of a new user by someone else
reasons.FIRSTUSE_EXISTINGUSER: First use of app (if no registration email sent)
reasons.EMAIL_CHANGED_OLDADDRESS: Login email changed (send to old email address)
reasons.EMAIL_CHANGED_NEWADDRESS: Login email changed (send to new email address)

manageapp.admin_only: Only a MIDATA admin may change this section. Please request changes if required.

info.filename: This name is internally used to identify your app. Should be a valid identifier (a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _).
info.targetUserRole: Is your app for a specific role only? Otherwise choose 'Any Role'.
info.type: Choose 'Plugin' if your app will run as MIDATA portal plugin. Choose 'Mobile App' for an external application. Choose 'OAuth1 Import' or 'OAuth2 Import' if you need to connect to an external server using OAuth1 or OAuth2.
info.name: The name of your app or plugin that will be presented to the end user.
info.description: A description of your plugin that will also be shown on the marked place.
info.resharesData: App is allowed to reshare data it has access to to 3rd party.
info.allowsUserSearch: Users of the app are allowed to search for other users of the same app.
info.defaultSpaceName: Title of the tile for your plugin on the dashboard.
info.tags: Categories on the market place for which your plugin should be listed.
info.url: URL of your plugins main page. If you use the template from MIDATA it is 'dist/index.html#?authToken=:authToken''
info.previewUrl: URL of your plugins dashboard tile. Leave empty if you do not provide such a tile.
info.defaultSpaceContext: Choose 'me' for the default dashboard. Choose 'config' if you write an import plugin.
info.defaultQuery_mobile: Query restricting the access of the app to the database. Access must be restricted by 'code', 'content' or 'group' and may be restricted by 'format' or 'owner'. Valid example (all Observations): '{ "group" : "all", "group-system" : "v1", "format" : ["fhir/Observation" ] }'
info.defaultQuery: Query restricting the access of the plugin to the database. Access must be restricted by at least one of 'code', 'content', 'group', 'format' or 'owner'. Valid example (all Observations): '{ "format" : ["fhir/Observation" ] }'
info.defaultQuery_extra: Look for valid values for 'code', 'content' or 'format' on the 'Format/Content' list of the developer guide. As a first version you may start with access to all data. For that use { "group" : "all", "group-system" : "v1" }. Please refine query before plugin or app goes in production.
info.secret: Your app will need this 'secret' during login. Choose whatever you like.
info.mustParticipateInStudy: User must participate in study in order to use app.
info.unlock_code: If filled out, this code must be entered by the user in order to sign up or log in the first time to MIDATA using the app. The code is not case sensitive.

query.self: App/Plugin may only access data of the person using it
query.ownapp: App/Plugin may only access data created using this app or plugin.
query.learn: Add all types written by the app automatically to the Access Query. (MUST be turned off before app goes productive)
query.all: During development allow to access all data of the user. (MUST be replaced with a proper query before plugin goes productive)

appstats.title: Debug Information for
appstats.run: Number of times the action has been invoked.
appstats.retry: Number of times operations had to be repeated because of concurrency issues.
appstats.db: Average number of internal database (MongoDB) queries executed per action invocation.
appstats.empty: No information has been recorded since debug information was last cleared.
